data.title: Changing the editor settings path has no effect
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 x64, v2.1.stable.official (also noticed this in 2.0)

**Issue description**
I could change the path for the editor settings, but when restarting the editor, the old default path is set again.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open the **Editor Settings**.
2. Under **Resource**, change the value of the **Path** property (being the expanded `%APPDATA%/Godot/editor_settings.tres` path yet).
3. Enter a new path (I ensured the directory exists, and at a 2nd try also copied the `editor_settings.tres` file there).
4. Close the **Editor Settings** window.
5. Restart the editor.
6. Check the settings. The **Path** value is back at `%APPDATA%/Godot/editor_settings.tres`.

data.title: Cannot import editor themes / error while saving editor theme
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.1-stable_win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I wanted to import some editor themes from [here](https://github.com/Geequlim/godot-code/tree/master/styles/syntax), however, after selecting a theme file nothing happens. I also receive an "Error while saving theme" when I try to save a theme.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1) Open a script file.
2) Import a theme or save a theme

data.title: Snap Visual Script connections
data.body: Right now you have to be pixel precise to create connection between nodes. It'd be much better if the connection snapped when the mouse is close to a connection point (much like the grid snapping).

data.body:

Windows 7 64 bit professional

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

This is in the log:

ERROR: FileAccessWindows::close: Condition ' rename_error ' is true.
   At: drivers\windows\file_access_windows.cpp:139**

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just changing and editing a script file seems to cause it.

data.title: Constant expressions not allowed in export var ranges
data.body:
Neither referencing previously defined consts nor using numeric-only expressions (e.g. 1.0/64) can be used in export var range hints.

```
export(float, 1.0/64, 64) # SCRIPT ERROR: GDScript::reload: Parse Error: Expected ',' or ')' in numeric range hint.
const a = 4
export(float, a, 5) # SCRIPT ERROR: GDScript::reload: Parse Error: Expected a range in numeric hint
```

data.title: Tagging code
data.body:
We were discussing different ways to make code tagging in Godot in #6371 and, since this idea is a little bit different, I'll make a separate discussion for it. 

**Why we need code tagging:** 
As projects grow, you get more and more code you need to manage. It's very likely that you forget about some incomplete, outdated or buggy block of code in some file. Code tagging can help with that, by showing code that needs attention.

**How this should work:** 
- By default there should be a list of commonly used tags like [Incomplete], [Needs fixing], [To do] etc.
- Users should be able to create their own tags
- Tag properties: name, background color
- In context menu of highlighted code, there should be [Apply Tag] dropdown menu. After user selects tag from it, background color behind selected lines of code should change to tag color
  ![screenshot at 2016-09-04 14 33 47](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/18230905/451507dc-72b2-11e6-84c7-ffabcd0f0251.png)
- [Metrics] button on the panel with [Tutorials] and [Classes] could show the window with list of files with tagged code as well as percentage of tagged code in file/project

data.title: Misspelled resource works
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu / Linux - Godot 2.1 Estable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

On the other hand, on android it makes the screen flick and the game crashes.

data.title: Keyboard Input hangs for modifier keys like Ctrl / Shift
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.2 as of 77cb836, Linux

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Keyboard Input doesn't get released for modifier keys like Ctrl or Shift.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Assign Shift to some action (for example "test")
- in a _process function get the value of `Input.is_action_pressed("test")`

After hitting Shift once, `Input.is_action_pressed("test")` will always return true.

data.title: Editor Hangs importing Collada File
data.body:
First, thanks for making this software, enjoying it so far.

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 bit Professional
Godot version: 2.1 stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Importing the attached dae file causes the editor to stop responding. I let it run for 5 minutes before killing it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import -> Mesh.  Select attached DAE file.  Left generate tangents and weld vertices checked.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
[Lowres_man.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/453588/Lowres_man.zip)

PS. I saw the other bug about godot.exe being on a different drive than the file.  This is not the case here.

data.title: FileDialog not showing buttons until moved
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
PC - Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1 (stable)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I have a project in which I created two FileDialog instances. When I press a button to show the Dialogs, they show up without the "Cancel" or "Open" buttons. However, if I move them, even if just a pixel, they start showing the buttons (and they show them correctly any time after that).

This is a GIF recording of it happening on my project: http://recordit.co/29jPWiz10S

Also, while creating the example I noticed that the buttons show up way below the Dialog when it is shown. The reason it doesn't happen in the example (anymore) or in my project is because the size of the dialog makes the buttons get off screen (when I discovered it the Dialog was still small).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add a FileDialog that covers most of the screen
Add a button
Wire the button to show the dialog

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

The link for the minimal example project:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/8c4v080k0wgsqx8/FileDialog%20Issue.zip?dl=1

data.title: Android IAP: Leave in core or create a separate module?
data.body:
I worked on Android IAP from the core, I will made a PR for this, but a doubt come to me: It is a module like, is there any interest on make this as a module or better leave in the code?

If you want to see this working you can see on:
https://godotdevelopers.org/forum/discussion/17400/monty
(I dont want to put the Google Play link directly beacouse this is for developing purpose only, not for promo)

I want to put other doubt on the table:
I'm thinking that the best way to make a good export to Android with modules is by separating the code of creating a template into a plugin like the asset manager (with gradle), the plugin will be able to compile templates and export to Android (for example), and all modules could be dropped and customize the entire exportation. It this in mind or something?

Comments are very appreciated :)
Thanks!

data.title: Unknown, silent locking up with a project.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1+. Ubuntu 16.04 64-bit, also tested on Windows 8.1 64-bit.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
This project silently locks up when you attempt to load it. No warnings or errors are printed on the terminal. CPU core usage shoots up to 100%+. On Linux, the only way to kill the process was from the terminal.

Further investigation by @SuperUserNameMan appeared to pinpoint the issue to Assets/UI/Themes/Default.tres, in particular the `[ext_resource path="res://Assets/Fonts/Roboto-Regular-16-bitmap.fnt" type="BitmapFont" id=1` line, though replacing the font does not resolve the issue. Editing the .tres file (or deleting it outright) also does not resolve this.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Unsure, but see link to project where this issue arose.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/67740160/Rogue_State_Lock.7z

data.title: Building for Android from Windows fails
Properties in the inspector lacking tooltips.
data.body:
I suspect this should have "Documentation" and "Discussion" tags at least.

A lot of properties for default nodes are lacking descriptive tooltips. For example, the "Under" and "Over" properties of TextureProgress display "property: texture/under", without any description of what the property actually does. Whereas the "Pos" property on the same node does (which appears to come from Rect, in the same way "Pos"'s tooltip on a Sprite comes from Node2D?).

What is the (best) way of adding these?

data.title: Graph nodes change width while being dragged around
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot Engine v2.2.alpha.custom_build(however I've noticed this behavior in previous versions as well)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
The graph nodes start to grow in width when being dragged around. I noticed that this behavior happens when the node gets past the center of graph editor, however that could also be when the node get's past the certain location of the grid. This also happens when I pan around with middle mouse. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add node, place it past center position and start dragging around- it's size will change. For a preview please have a look at gif. 
The current issue is about Visual Script editor, however this can also be achieved in Shader Graph editor as well. 

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
![shader_graph_node_scale](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9309589/18224106/fb63f5d4-71c2-11e6-86f9-2f2318d9640a.gif)

data.title: Auto-completion not working when using NodePath from exported variable.
data.body:
When using:

```
export(NodePath) var node

func some_func():
    get_node(node).node_method()

```

Auto-completion in Script Editor is not working while when using get_node("node_path_to_node") it is.

data.title: Drag'n'Drop nodes in scene to exported NodePath
data.body:
Would be awesome if it was possible to drop nodes from Scene Dock to exported NodePath property in Inspector Dock, like in Unity (sorry for saying that xDDD)

In current behavior user has to click property, click Assign, then Scene Tree Dialog shows up and user has to again find and select his node and click OK.

With d'n'd it would be to Lock Inspector on script node (? or any other idea) then find his nodes in 2D/3D view drag them to property in inspector. Done.

data.title: Particle System Improvement
data.body:
Godot's particle system is very simple and does its job very well, but some things can be added to it:

Random lifetime
Collision
Take out the delay it takes to emit particles when emitting is marked or make a emit() function
Array of colors to choose randomly
Fix randomness "bug" where if the param is 0 it doesn't do anything. Suggestion: make it more controllable, like if I put direction 10 and random direction 5 then it do 10 + randi_range(-5, 5)
Graph of size during lifetime

Off topic: add randi_range(min, max). No more cyber-bulling to integers!

data.title: Stringnames matching member variables get replaced by null by the compiler
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, Godot master HEAD (8ee2018)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I've discovered and bisected that since commit 2e5a4cb, my game [DynaDungeons](https://github.com/akien-mga/dynadungeons) no longer works as expected due to supernatural substitutions of valid strings by `Nil`.

I have strictly no clue how a change to InputEvent would break my singleton like this, but reverting it does fix the bug. CC @volzhs.

This trimmed-down test shows an example of the bug: http://hastebin.com/ofazepakoc.coffee

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
git clone https://github.com/akien-mga/dynadungeons
cd dynadungeons
godot -e
// Press run, see the debugger yelling at you
// Check the value for the `width` variable: it's empty!
// try to `print("width")` before the problematic call in `global.gd`: it prints an empty string
```

I wasn't yet able to make a minimal reproducer, the issue appears to be a bit non-deterministic.

data.title: Add LoD hysteresis
data.body:
Hi, after posting on [the forum](https://godotdevelopers.org/forum/discussion/comment/17817) people suggested me to post here.

Here is my suggestion for an implementation of the first part in Godot Engine (I will do another ticket for the smooth transition)

1) Add an hysteresis, which means when you trigger a LoD change, to trigger it back to it's previous state you must go to a bigger distance
For instance if we have a sphere that appears at 10 unit, to make it disappears, the player must go at ~13 units. This reduce the number of unwanted change.
That could be done automatically with a fixed constant directly in the engine (something like 5 or 3) or with an option in the global project setting. Putting this on a per node basis would be IMHO a vast of time and potentially confusing (if offsets aren't the same across all mesh of the same object it can cause problems).

In the global editor setting there would be simply an option LoD Hysteresis: and by default it would be at 0 (= no effect).

If devs are interested I can try to submit a patch :)

Sam

data.title: Node instances appear in the debugger as integers (instance ID)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Mageia 6 x64, current master HEAD.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
In the debugger, node instance (e.g. `var config = ConfigFile.new()`) appear in the debugger as integers, e.g. `788`, which is the node ID.
The String cast is much more helpful and should likely also be used in the debugger to avoid confusion: `[ConfigFile:788]`.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set a breakpoint just after `var config = ConfigFile.new()` and inspect the value of `config` in the debugger.

data.title: Observing fast moving Particles2D from a fast moving object causes visual glitch.
data.body:
**bugsquad edit:** issue is still present in 3.0 Reproduction project is in this comment: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6373#issuecomment-321977789

--------------

Linux Kubuntu 14.04 Godot v2.1stabel 

**Issue description**: Observing fast moving particles from a fast moving object that goes in the same direction makes the particles look jumpy like they are in two places at once.  

**Steps to reproduce:** 
Add player (rigid or kinematic body) and move it fast in one direction with attached current Camera2D.
Add Particles2D to the world and set set_initial_velocity( player.get_linear_velocity() ) and set set_pos(player.get_pos() ). 

**Link to minimal example project**:
[moving_particels.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/452465/moving_particels.tar.gz)
( spawns particles on hit return )

**Use case**: Creating hit debris in a space shooter that fly s independent alongside of the ship.

data.title: make "WORKAROUND", "TODO", "FIXME" officials gdscript keywords and keep a global list of them
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.x

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

It could be very handy ...

.... if the editor made possible to do global search for keywords or keychains into every scripts (including shader scripts), 

or

... if the editor kept a list of all scripts and lines where the words *WORKAROUND", "TODO", "FIXME", "WARNING" appear into comments or as new official keywords (that would be ignored like the `pass` kw )

**Steps to reproduce:**

Make a complicated project that contains many scripts with lots of workarounds, fixme and todo, and try to keep your code up to date with the fixes included into each new official stable godot release.

data.title: MaterialShader with swizzled UV2 can't compile
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1 and 2.0.4.1 win64 stable official.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

When I use UV2.x or UV2.y into a Vertex Shader, the shader compilation fails with this error (that i could not copy past as text ) :

![vertex_shader_uv2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9801802/18204272/2efe8a6e-711c-11e6-8da8-acc3794b9a94.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
VERTEX.xyz = VERTEX.xyz + NORMAL.xyz * UV2.x ;
```

if you replace UV2.x with UV.x, or with a constant it will work.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Tilemap editor: Bucket tool - allow deleting and replacing of tiles
AnimatedSprite spritesheet support
data.body:
This might be a duplicate of #344, but that issue is over 2 years old so I thought it'd be better to make a new one instead to bring fresh discussion.

---

It's inconsistent for Sprite to handle spritesheets and AnimatedSprite to handle multiple image sprites. Sprite should be just a simple Node that renders a 2D image with a definable sub region. It shouldn't also do sprite animations -- that's what AnimatedSprite is for: a sprite that has multiple frames defined by a SpriteFrame (or multiple images) and animates it very simply. If users want more customized sprite animations, they can use an AnimationPlayer; otherwise the AnimatedSprite handles majority of animated sprite cases in an easy format.

The other issue with Sprite doing animations, is that animating them requires an AnimationPlayer, which becomes really tedious to adjust the Sprite:frame for each key for each animation (unless I'm unaware of a better method).
